alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:46AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Whiteside, southeastern Rock Island, northwestern Henry, Scott, southwestern Clinton and southeastern Cedar Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 545 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eldridge, or near Davenport, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Eldridge around 550 AM CDT. Davenport around 555 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rock Island, Bettendorf, Riverdale, Moline, East Moline, Le Claire, Hampton, Silvis, Rapids City, Colona, Coal Valley, Cleveland, Osborn and Warner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 281 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 5, and between mile markers 16 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
